notesStmt.note: Margins slightly damaged at the end.
Yitsḥaḳ ben Mosheh de Pisa (?): inscribed in a deed of sale, with a witness' name Mordekhai ben Shimshon Ḥizḳiyah, dated Friday, 26 Tishri, folio .
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 48 quires of 8 leaves each (apart from no. 32 which has 10 leaves).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script of approximately 12th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 136r A passage written in a geometrical design.

binding.p: Post-1600, brown leather, blind-tooled, with remains of clasps. Spine title: 'I. Bereshith Rabbah. II. Siphra. III. Siphre. IV. Petirath Aharon u-Mosheh. Hebrew & Aramaic. Brit. Mus. Additional 16.406.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased by the British Museum from Payne & Foss on 9 January 1847; originally Rezzi collection: inscribed folio [387v].
